Kup/Windlord:

Kup keeps firing and moving hoping to give  enough time for Windlord to 
perfom his part of the plan.  Windlord did an enigmating smile while he fly 
down  trying to avoid the radars, he circle around the Base's perimeter 
getting closser and closser looking for a spot to drop Rattrap safely

-----Original Message----- 
From: Sandy
Sent: Sunday, December 05, 2010 11:24 AM
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: Operation Black Tower

Quickstride walks up to a higher hill, to see if he can spot any activity 
from long range, and notices that the jets are now flying in a totally 
different direction, incicating that their attentions have been put 
elsewhere.

"Rodimus, you're right, somethn' just caught those jet's attentions.. 
Whatever Tucson had up his manifold, looks like it's working.  Still, I 
dunno if I'm ready ta let my guard down just yet."

From the firing range, Night Shift could see that Tucson's ploy was working, 
as Straight Shot works in unisen with Kup.  With the arrows fired, Straight 
Shot gives Kup the data he needs to make a direct hit, via using her 
physical weaponry form, and her guidence systems.  It was now up to Kup to 
do the rest.

"Nice firing Kup, it's working!  I'll continue to download the trajectory 
coordinates to you, and hopefully we'll get those plane brains to focus on 
something else other than the fortress."

Night Shift nodds.

"Looks good, they're buyn' it.  I dunno if we should stay still though, they 
could get a fix on us and then we're curtains.  I vote we slowly change our 
locations after a few shots, so that way we can confuse the living heck outa 
their processors."

From Tucson's vantage point, although unable to see what was happening, he 
keeps his com links open to his colleagues.  And from what he could surmise, 
things were going according to plan.  But yet he still had to think of the 
"What If's."  There was always a chance that even a well thought out 
strategy could go awry.

"From what I hear,things appear to be going well.  But we can not discount 
the fact that events have a way of turning on us abruptly.  Continue on your 
paths, but be cautious."

Rat Trap who was now with Windlord was happy to see that the jets were being 
distracted away from the fortress.

"We copy that Wheels, okay Windlord, I think we can make our move, the 
distraction's working.  I'll leave it up ta you ta find the best way in. 
You know this place better than I do."

Tucson now continues to move in slowly.  He keeps to hidden areas on the 
land with low vegitation, and travels by river beds, to be sure that his 
tires do not kick up any dirt or rubble.  His trailer keeps him from moving 
too fast, as he tries to maneuver it through the terrain.  That however did 
not bother him in the least.  He had never been one for speed, even in his 
old SUV form.  Things seemed rather familliar to him now, the way the 
situation was playing out, reminded him of older times, when Optimus Prime 
would lead his Autobots against the Decepticons and how careful he was with 
his strategic skills.   And now, it was Tucson Prime's turn to roll in 
Optimus Prime's tire treads.  As Hydras was a cobination of Galvatron and 
Megatron, Tucson Prime now comes to terms that Optimus Prime was now living 
within himself and for all intensive purposes, he is now the new Optimus 
Prime.  He now sends a message to all Autobots and Maximals.

" Before I met up with all of you, my direction was unclear.  I thought that 
I'd be fighting a losing battle by myself, and for a long time, it seemed 
that way.  But then, along my travels, I met all of you, and you brought me 
home, to the Ark, where you showed me where Optimus Prime rests.  At first, 
I wished intensely that Optimus Prime could be brought back to life, and I 
believed that for the longest time.  Then, as I got to know all of you, and 
realized the big picture of what was happening, and then, recieving the 
power of the Matrix of Leadership, I have now come to realize that it's far 
better to look ahead at who is around you now, and what is to happen in the 
future than to dwell on that of the past.  All of that would not have been 
possible if I had not met all of you.  And for that I thank each and every 
Autobot and Maximal for putting me on the right path.  And now, it's time 
for me to repay my debt to you all."

He thinks for a moment.

" As Optimus Prime stood firmly against Megatron and the Decepticon Faction, 
I will firmly stand my ground against the Predacons and Decepticons.  And by 
the end of this battle, we will show them that it's unwise to underestimate 
our factions as they have done so up until now."

He inches closser into his position.

" Let this be known, that to all Predacons and Decepticons, it will be a day 
of reckoning."



--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Super Cyclonus <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
> > <OLD>
> >
> > Quickstride keeps his nose, ears and eyes open for signs of trouble.
> Something definitely made him uneasy, yet he could not put his hoof on it.
> >
> > "I copy you on that Rodimus... I can't figure it out but something is
> making the mane on my neck stand on end.. Sorta like a horsefly ya can't
> shake off..."
> >
> > Tucson acknowledges Rodimus quickly.
>
> <NEW>
>
> "Yeah, I have gotten that feeling before." Rodimus said over the com line 
> to
> Quickstride, "But we can get this off without a hitch." He chuckled, "I
> don't see any hordes of Predacons coming down on us. That probably means
> they haven't been watching."
>
> While Rodimus said this with the confidence of a leader, inside he knew 
> that
> it was possible. Hydras is smart and Cyclonus was as well. It was indeed
> difficult to know that the Predacons had going on.
>
> > <OLD>
> >
> > " Thank you for the intel Rodimus. Now I will be able to keep my sensors
> open for any wave disturbances. Ususally my sonar systems only pick up on
> solid objects, but there is a chance that fluxuations in energy waves, can
> be detected via echolocation. My systems are up and running now.. But
> there's one flaw, that kind of detection system is short range. If there's
> any disturbances long range, I will not be able to detect them. I will do
> the best I can to keep alert."
> >
> > He rolls on with caution, trying not to kick up any dirt, or disturb
> anything around him. As tires roll over uneven ground his trailer rocks
> slightly as he tries hard to avoid too much movement from it.
>
> <NEW>
>
> "I understand." Rodimus said over the comlink, clearly confident in 
> Tuscon's
> abilities. "I am going radio silent. Cheetor said that the Preds could 
> hear
> him. The sweeps have excellent hearing, and who knows what Hydras has 
> built
> out there."
>
>
> > <OLD>
> >
> > "Here is Windlord"said the male by comlink in a private maximal 
> > chanel"I'm
> > ready and in position"
> >
> > Kup took straing shot and said "Time to have some fun" he startd to 
> > track
> > the enemy signature and opened fire against them
>
>
> <NEW>
>
> For Kup and Straight Shot, trying to track the sweeps out there was trying
> to track ripples of heat rising on a desert savanna. Target locks ranged
> from fleeting to next to impossible as the sweeps themselves flew through
> the the air.
>
> Optical sighting however proved effective as Kup pulled the trigger and 
> with
> a light *kuthunk!* he sent an arrow into the air, and then another and
> another. Quickly the small volley of arrows flew into the air rising in a
> large arc, moving farther and more swiftly then any conventional arrow 
> could
> have traveled.
>
> It was difficult to see clearly at this distance (20K) but it was obvious
> that at least one of the sweeps was hit as one of them began to fall from
> the skies, smoke trailing after it. However the other four reacted! Like
> bees hows hive had been disturbed, they flew around, erratic at first as 
> if
> trying to discern the angle of attack, and then they began to fly in Kup's
> direction.
>
> Although they were still some kilometers away they were quickly closing 
> the
> distance, they began to open fire as they closed!
>
> OOC: They sweeps are still several miles away, so the shots are more or 
> less
> at long range. Its up to you guys if you want to be hit or not.
>
> (TAG)
>
> Preston
